docs.lead_paragraph: SCHWARTZ--Jerome Martin, Ph.D. Jerry passed away on June 10, 2009 after a six year battle with pancreatic cancer. Born October 20, 1940 to Gustave and Marjorie Schwartz (deceased), he received degrees from the City College of New York (BS), New York University (MS), and the University of Chicago (Ph.D., 1969; Virology). He then achieved the rank of Research Associate Professor in the Laboratory of Neurovirology at the Mount Sinai School of Medicine in New York City, where he published many important original studies concerning the viral etiology of diseases of the nervous system. In 1982, Dr. Schwartz became Research Director at the Schering-Plough Pharmaceutical Corporation at Kenilworth, New Jersey (head of the Departments of Antiviral Chemotherapy and Molecular Pharmacology), making major contributions to the successful discovery and development of the drugs Inton A and Rebetron. These have become the cornerstone treatments for hepatitis C viral infections worldwide. He then went on to become Senior Vice President at United Health Group (Ingenix Division) interfacing with major pharmaceutical companies, facilitating the development and introduction of their novel, important drugs. Jerry is survived by his loving and dedicated lifetime partner, the poet Dennis V. Dever ("The Uses of This World") and their dearest friend Theodore Anthony Lee. He is also survived by his beloved sister Susan (Fred Snowflack) and dearest brother Richard (Doris), loving cousins Gail (Allan) London, Arlene Jacobs, and Glenn (Roz) Lessey and their families. He is also survived by a multitude of cherished friends, including Bernard Weinstein, Ph.D. (Lois), Bill Wiesner (Ph.D.), and a lifetime's worth of many, many valued, talented, and dedicated professional colleagues. A graveside service was held at George Washington Memorial Park, Paramus, NJ, on Friday, June 12, 2009 at 11:00am. McCorry Brothers, Cliffside Park, NJ handled the services.
